Schönbrunn Palace.name: Schönbrunn Palace
Schönbrunn Palace.description: The former summer residence of the Habsburgs, famed for its Gloriette, grand gardens, and Baroque architecture.

Sisi Museum.name: Sisi Museum
Sisi Museum.description: Dedicated to Empress Elisabeth (Sisi), showcasing her personal artifacts, dresses, and the romantic yet tragic aspects of her life.

Mozart Museum.name: Mozart Museum
Mozart Museum.description: Located in Mozart's former residence, displaying his original scores, instruments, and family memorabilia.

Haus der Musik.name: Haus der Musik
Haus der Musik.description: An interactive sound museum exploring music, acoustics, and Vienna's great composers with hands‑on exhibits.

Freud Museum.name: Freud Museum
Freud Museum.description: Preserves the apartment and office of Sigmund Freud, with original furniture, Freud's psychoanalytic couch, and archives.

University of Vienna.name: University of Vienna
University of Vienna.description: One of Europe’s oldest universities where Freud studied and later taught, with historic lecture halls and archives.

Belvedere Museum.name: Belvedere Museum
Belvedere Museum.description: A historic Baroque palace complex housing Austria's largest collection of Gustav Klimt paintings, including 'The Kiss'.

Kunsthistorisches Museum.name: Kunsthistorisches Museum
Kunsthistorisches Museum.description: One of the world’s most important fine arts museums, with collections spanning ancient to modern art, including masterpieces by Klimt.
